duties_responsibilities.duty: Using clinical reasoning, conducts accurate clinical assessments according to practice standards.
Helps evidence-based practice changes through research utilization and experiential learning.
Creates an attentive, helpful, safe and therapeutic environment for patients, families, and staff.
Recognizes, appreciates, and incorporates a patient's and family's unique differences into an individualized plan of care.
Preserves and protects the confidentiality, autonomy, dignity, and rights of patients and families.
Facilitates learning for patients and families, nursing staff, and other members of the health care team.
Works collaboratively and interdependently with colleagues and community to develop and implement an integrated plan of care.
Uses strategies and available resources for problem-solving for patients, family, and staff.
Improves nursing practice and the work environment through participating in mutual governance and conclusion-making processes.
Identifies personal goals and fulfills ongoing professional growth through continuing education and seeking advanced degrees.
Develops, evaluates, implements, and as necessary, modifies a patient care plan to meet the needs of separate patients.
Communicates thoughts clearly, both verbally and in writing.
